intro: Oreobolopsis inversa, commonly known as the inverted oreobolopsis, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features a basal rosette of narrow, grey-green leaves that are covered in fine hairs, providing protection against desiccation. Its inflorescence consists of yellow disk flowers surrounded by white ray florets, which attract pollinators. Oreobolopsis inversa is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments through its succulent leaves and deep root system.
